thanks for the investigation as well.

body: hmmm, it may be safe to remove `document.contains` on the radio/checkboxes, I will wait for how many users want this feature before the implementation. closing and move to the feature board. thanks again for the feature request and investigation as well.

You're welcome, it was an interesting investigation.

I noticed that `document.contains` is also used in live.ts. I don't know for what purpose that code is used, but I can imagine it also causes bugs in Shadow DOM roots.

Anyway, many thanks for react-hook-form and your time!

yea thanks @jorrit I am keeping an eye on this. reason: I was playing safe with the edge case when the user unmounts a single radio input out of a group of radio inputs because react hook form support uncontrolled (native) inputs (when user set shouldUnregister: true), but think twice I think we probably can take the tradeoff by remove `.live` eventually. let's see if other users encounter the same issue.

Just want to mention I am also experiencing a similar issue with radio inputs in the shadow dom. In my case the radios are all selectable but only the last option's value works, the others always return null when selected. Happy to provide any info.

issue.title: issue: Radio Inputs Do Not Register Correctly In React Portals

repository.name: react-hook-form
repository.description: ðŸ“‹ React Hooks for form state management and validation (Web + React Native)

issue.body:
### Version Number

7.23.0

### Codesandbox/Expo snack

https://codesandbox.io/s/sharp-joliot-5cb75?file=/src/App.js

### Steps to reproduce

1. Use sandbox, observe the same form rendered twice, once normally and once in a portal.
2. The normal form works fine but the portaled form only allows the _last_ option to be registered. use the submit button to see this in action

### Expected behaviour

Shouldn't this work the same in both cases? Perhaps this is because of some unusualness with my `Portal` implementation, but note this is very similar to the portal example from the official React docs.

After some debugging, I think this is a related issue to https://github.com/react-hook-form/react-hook-form/issues/6776, though not exactly the same. I think this comes down to this `live` check for radio and checkbox inputs. In the version I originally discovered this in (`7.22`), there's a `document.contains(el)` check, which won't be true when the refs are registered, since the `useEffect` hasn't attached the portal to the DOM yet. I know in newer versions, the form submission now causes a crash. Unfortunately, even if this crash is fixed, I believe latest version will use `el.isConnected` which is still falsy before the `useEffect` runs.

### What browsers are you seeing the problem on?

Firefox, Chrome
